description: The FHS segment is used to head a file (group of batches) as defined in Section 2.10.3, "HL7 batch protocol".

1.name: File Field Separator
1.description: This field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment.

10.name: File Header Comment
10.description: This field contains the free text field, the use of which is not further specified.

11.name: File Control Id
11.description: This field is used to identify a particular file uniquely. It can be echoed back in FHS-12-reference file control ID.

12.name: Reference File Control Id
12.description: This field contains the value of FHS-11-file control ID when this file was originally transmitted. Not present if this file is being transmitted for the first time.

13.name: File Sending Network Address
13.description: Identifier of the network location the message was transmitted from. Identified by an OID or text string (e.g., URI). The reader is referred to the "Report from the Joint W3C/IETF URI Planning Interest Group: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs), URLs, and Uniform Resource Names (URNs): Clarifications and Recommendations".

14.name: File Receiving Network Address
14.description:
Identifier of the network location the message was transmitted to. Identified by an OID or text string. (e.g., URL).

This is analogous with the Sending Network Address, however in the receiving role.

This field should only be populated when the underlying communication protocol does not support identification receiving network locations.

2.name: File Encoding Characters
2.description: This field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment.

4.name: File Sending Facility
4.description: This field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment.

5.name: File Receiving Application
5.description: This field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment.

6.name: File Receiving Facility
6.description: This field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment.

7.name: File Creation Date/Time
7.description: This field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment.

8.name: File Security
8.description: This field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment.

9.name: File Name/Id
9.description: This field can be used by the application processing file. Its use is not further specified.
